docs.abstract: What should be more important to women: A positive body image or a fit physique that is less at risk for diabetes and other health issues?

docs.lead_paragraph: The virulence of Type 2 diabetes in children is yet another reason to fight childhood obesity.
docs.abstract: Editorial cites a study of overweight and obese children published in The New England Journal of Medicine that has found that Type 2 diabetes progresses faster and is harder to treat in young people than in adults; criticizes Congressional Republicans for attempting to dismantle health care reforms that could greatly assist in curbing the obesity epidemic.
docs.snippet: The virulence of Type 2 diabetes in children is yet another reason to fight childhood obesity.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama campaign invents a cartoon everywoman whose partner is, of course, big government.
docs.abstract: Ross Douthat Op-Ed column criticizes the Obama campaign ad that illustrates the government's role in every stage of the life of a fictional woman named Julia; asserts that the ad is a demonstration of the intrusions of contemporary liberalism.
docs.snippet: The Obama campaign invents a cartoon everywoman whose partner is, of course, big government.

docs.lead_paragraph: When her husband lost his job and the bank began foreclosing on their house, Cathy Yoder turned her coupon habit into a growing business.

headline.seo: Coupon Clipping as the Key to Economic Rebirth
headline.main: Honey, I Got a Year’s Worth of Tuna Fish
headline.print_headline: Honey, I Got a Year’s Worth Of Tuna Fish

docs.abstract: Amanda Fortini article on Idaho native Cathy Yoder, who turned her coupon-clipping habit into a growing business; Yoder and her business partner Monica Knight manage the Web site Fabulessly Frugal, and are part of a growing community of people for whom coupons are a significant part of making ends meet.
docs.snippet: When her husband lost his job and the bank began foreclosing on their house, Cathy Yoder turned her coupon habit into a growing business.

docs.lead_paragraph: Angélica Moreno is celebrated in Mexico for being the first to market a form of this region’s traditional handmade Talavera pottery that features contemporary high-end design.

headline.print_headline: An Entrepreneur at the Vanguard of Pottery

docs.lead_paragraph: As patients assume more of the responsibility for costs, complex billing and more aggressive collection by providers are resulting in negative credit report data that lingers for years.

headline.seo: Medical Debts Can Leave Stains on Credit Scores
headline.main: Discrepancies on Medical Bills Can Leave a Credit Stain

docs.abstract: Medical bill paying is becoming more complex as patients take on a greater share of costs, causing many patients to fall victim to aggressive collection by providers when they make errors; even small mistakes related to multiple bills, deductibles or coinsurance can result in negative credit report data that lingers for years.
docs.snippet: As patients assume more of the responsibility for costs, complex billing and more aggressive collection by providers are resulting in negative credit report data that lingers for years.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: As parents proudly watch their offspring collect their college diplomas this month, consider this: More than half of baby boomers say they have allowed their adult children to move back home, rent free. That was among the findings in a survey commissioned by Ameriprise Financial. The research company GfK conducted the survey by landline and cellphone in December of 1,006 baby boomers -- those born from 1946 to 1964 -- with $100,000 or more in investable assets. The firm also polled 300 parents of boomers and 300 adult children of boomers. The margin of sampling error is plus or minus three percentage points for the boomers, and six percentage points for the parents and children.
docs.snippet: As parents proudly watch their offspring collect their college diplomas this month, consider this: More than half of baby boomers say they have allowed their adult children to move back home, rent free.     That was among the findings in a survey...
